Posts.Title: Seroma again---Sigh dibel dibel

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2008 04:14AM dibel wrote: Persistent it is---I will call today and see what they want to do.  I always get these things on weekends.
Posts.Title: Seroma again---Sigh dibel dibel

Posts.Content: dibel wrote: I think I should change my last name to Seroma.  I've already had 2 hematomas, finally had to have surgery to close up the wound.  That was 4 weeks ago.  So this morning, I get out my yoga mat, get into position to start and look down and the mat is flooded with light pinkish brown fluid.  I just had my first appt with the radiologist for the markings and studies with the anticipation of starting radiology in the next couple of weeks.  It has already been delayed due to the hematoma/seroma issues.  So, here's another one.  The area that leaked is not as large as before (previous was abour an inch opening.)  This one looks like the head of half a Q tip.  If anyone had this happen this many times, I was wondering if radiation will be again delayed for healing.  I'm so disgusted!!!!!!!!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Seroma again---Sigh dibel dibel

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2008 11:54PM dibel wrote: Yes, it would be disturbing to jump from st. 1 to st.3.  They did explain that to me.  The breast surgeon told me today that I have a 50% chance of the cancer recurring in 5 years but the Herceptin will help the odds.  I didn't like the news but will live with it.
Posts.Title: Path report back--Licking my wounds dibel bluesky

Posts.Content: dibel wrote: I finally got my results from my lumpectomy and axillary disection last week.  Although the tumor had shrunk, it was still there and the surgeon did not get clear margins.  I'm going back to surgery on Monday for another go at it.  We thought there were only 2 nodes involved prior to the dissection but now there are 4.  Initially, I was pretty bummed out but after talking with my treatment team, the only thing that will change will be a more inclusive radiation treatment.  Any thoughts on this report??? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Path report back--Licking my wounds dibel bluesky

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2008 11:57PM dibel wrote: The Dr gave me the choice of redoing the lumpectomy margins or doing a mastectomy.  We both decided on the margin cleanup.  That will be Tuesday.  Hope she gets everything this wee.  Thanks very much for your post.  It is comforting during these days when there isn't a great deal of good news.
